headline: Why auto tariffs will be extra harsh on Ford, GM, & Stellantis
summary: The Big Three automakers — Ford (F), General Motors (GM), and Stellantis (STLA) — are the most exposed to US President Trump's auto tariffs, even when compared to foreign automakers, according to auto data firm JATO Dynamics. Senior Autos Reporter Pras Subramanian joins Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton on Market Domination Overtime to take a closer look at the auto sector. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: Gentherm Recognized as 2024 Supplier of the Year by General Motors
summary: NOVI, Mich., April 08, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Today, General Motors presented Gentherm with a 2024 Supplier of the Year Award at GM’s 33rd annual Supplier of the Year event in Phoenix, Arizona. This is the third time Gentherm has received the award. “We are incredibly honored to be recognized as a General Motors Supplier of the Year,” said Jaymi Wilson, Senior Vice President and General Manager, North America Automotive and Global Sales and Marketing at Gentherm. “This award reflects the long-

headline: Cadillac ending production of three-row, gasoline-powered XT6 SUV
summary: General Motors GM.N is discontinuing the Cadillac XT6 gasoline-powered three-row SUV at the end of 2025, the automaker said on Tuesday.  The XT6 is built at Spring Hill Assembly in Tennessee where GM also produces the smaller gasoline-powered Cadillac XT5 SUV, which GM will continue making through the end of 2026.  The Spring Hill plant also has the Cadillac electric SUVs Lyriq and Vistiq.

headline: Detroit's Big Three — not foreign automakers — are most exposed to Trump's auto tariffs: New report
summary: A new report finds that Detroit’s Big Three are actually the most exposed to President Trump’s 25% auto tariffs on foreign-made cars.

headline: U.S. tariffs impact on global auto industry
summary: Investing.com -- U.S. President Donald Trump’s newly confirmed 25% global tariffs on foreign autos and parts are set to disrupt the global automotive landscape, triggering production shifts, halting asset sales, and pressuring margins across regions.
